025package io.blt.util;
026
027import io.blt.util.functional.ThrowingRunnable;
028import io.blt.util.functional.ThrowingSupplier;
029import java.util.function.Function;
030
031/**
032 * Static utility methods centred around {@code Exception} and {@code Throwable}.
033 * <p>Includes raising and handling exceptions.</p>
034 */
035public final class Ex {
036
037    private Ex() {
038        throw new IllegalAccessError("Utility class should be accessed statically and never constructed");
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * Executes a supplier, transforming any thrown exception using a specified function.
043     * e.g., say we have a custom high-level {@code XmlProcessingException} that we want to raise when parsing XML:
044     * <pre>{@code
045     * public Document parseXml(String pathname) throws XmlProcessingException {
046     *     return Ex.transformExceptions(
047     *             () -> DocumentBuilderFactory
048     *                     .newInstance()
049     *                     .newDocumentBuilder()       // throws ParserConfigurationException
050     *                     .parse(new File(pathname)), // throws SAXException, IOException
051     *             XmlProcessingException::new);
052     * }
053     * }</pre>
054     *
055     * @param <R>         The result type of the supplier
056     * @param <E>         The type of transformed exception
057     * @param supplier    The supplier that may throw an exception
058     * @param transformer Function to transform exceptions thrown by the supplier
059     * @return The result of the supplier if successful
060     * @throws E If the supplier throws an exception, transformed by the provided function
061     */
062    public static <R, E extends Throwable> R transformExceptions(
063            ThrowingSupplier<R, ? extends Exception> supplier, Function<? super Exception, E> transformer) throws E {
064        try {
065            return supplier.get();
066        } catch (RuntimeException e) {
067            throw e;
068        } catch (Exception e) {
069            throw transformer.apply(e);
070        }
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * Executes a runnable, transforming any thrown exception using a specified function
075     * e.g.,
076     * <pre>{@code
077     * public void appendFormattedDateToFile(String date, String fileName) throws LoggingException {
078     *     Ex.transformExceptions(
079     *             () -> {
080     *                 var formatted = new SimpleDateFormat()
081     *                         .parse(date)            // ParseException
082     *                         .toString();
083     *
084     *                 Files.write(                    // IOException
085     *                         Paths.get(fileName),
086     *                         formatted.getBytes(),
087     *                         StandardOpenOption.APPEND);
088     *             }, LoggingException::new
089     *     );
090     * }
091     * }</pre>
092     *
093     * @param <E>         The type of transformed exception
094     * @param runnable    The runnable that may throw an exception
095     * @param transformer Function to transform exceptions thrown by the supplier
096     * @throws E If the supplier throws an exception, transformed by the provided function
097     */
098    public static <E extends Throwable> void transformExceptions(
099            ThrowingRunnable<? extends Exception> runnable, Function<? super Exception, E> transformer) throws E {
100        transformExceptions(() -> {
101            runnable.run();
102            return null;
103        }, transformer);
104    }
105
106}
